title: Skew: Skiing Contest
question_text:
Bobosaur and Turtle both love to ski. They each raced down the same mountain $25$ times. Bobosaur had a mean time of $87\text{ seconds}$ and a median time of $87\text{ seconds}$. Turtle had a mean time of $104\text{ seconds}$ and a median time of $96\text{ seconds}$.
Which of the following statements is TRUE?

choices.text: It is likely that both distributions have no skew.
It is likely that the distribution for Turtle is left skewed and the distribution for Bobosaur has no skew.
It is likely that the distribution for Turtle is right skewed and the distribution for Bobosaur has no skew.
It is likely that the distribution for Turtle has no skew and the distribution for Bobosaur is left skewed.
It is likely that the distribution for Turtle has no skew and the distribution for Bobosaur is right skewed.

solution:
The mean is sensitive to outliers and the median is resistant to outliers. Imagine a distribution with values of 5,5,5,5, and 55. The median would be 5, but the mean would be 15.

Therefore, if Turtle's distribution has a mean of 104 seconds and a median of 96 seconds, then the mean is greater than the median. So Turtle has a mean greater than the median and likely has a right skew.

Bobosaur's mean and median are identical, which means his data likely has no skew.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect because Turtle has a mean time which is greater than his median. If there is no skew, then the mean is near the median.

Choice 'B' is incorrect because Turtle has a mean time which is greater than his median, which results in a right skew. To have a left skew, the mean should be less than the median.

Choice 'D' is incorrect both because Turtle should have a right skew and because Bobosaur should have no skew. Since Bobosaur has the same mean and median, Bobosaur should have no skew. If Bobosaur had a left skew, the mean would be below the median.

Choice 'D' is incorrect both because Turtle should have a right skew and because Bobosaur should have no skew. Since Bobosaur has the same mean and median, Bobosaur should have no skew. If Bobosaur had a right skew, the mean would be above the median.
